page.title: 18CHURCHES IN PRESTON
page.content: St.Martin's Church,Preston,was built in 1899,when the Rev.B.N.Switzer first decided that Preston should have its own church.In earlier times the Minsden Chapel of St.Nicholas was used for both Preston and Langley but this fell into disrepair in the 17th century. It was used as a fashionable place to be married,even as a ruin.In 1849 a dual purpose church_school building was erected in School Lane,this served the community until St.Martin's Church was built.The building is now demolished.Between those dates we assume that the village met informally to worship,as there was a strong non_conformist element locally.Some may have travelled to St. Mary's Hitchin, others may have atten_ ded St. Ippolyt's Church or Kings Walden.
